H0.text: Which artery is the main source of blood for the leg. Popliteal artery

H1.text: Which artery is the main source of blood for the leg. Tibial artery

H2.text: Which artery is the main source of blood for the leg. Peroneal artery

H3.text: Which artery is the main source of blood for the leg. Femoral pulse

A4.text: The femoral artery is a large artery in the thigh and the main arterial supply to the thigh and leg.

A5.text: Presence of a femoral pulse indicates a systolic blood pressure of more than 50 mmHg.

A6.text: The popliteal artery branches into the anterior and posterior tibial arteries.

A7.text: The fibular artery typically arises from the posterior tibial artery.

A8.text: The fibular artery arises from the tibial-fibular trunk.

A9.text: It supplies a perforating branch to both the lateral and anterior compartments of the leg; it also provides a nutrient artery to the fibula.
